= How to build agileplanner-for-econference plug-in =

== Build the eConference 3.x ==
Follow the [http://code.google.com/p/econference/wiki/HowToBuildEConf instructions] to build eConference 3.x

== Build the econference-planning-poker-plugin 1.x ==
Follow the [http://code.google.com/p/econference-planning-poker-plugi/wiki/HowToBuildEConf3P instructions] to build econference-planning-poker-plugin 1.x

== Checkout the SVN repository ==

After that, open the _Window | Open perspective_ menu (see Fig. 3)...

<p align=center>http://econference.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/svn2.JPG <br>
<p align=center>*Figure 3. Display all the available perspectives*</p>
<br>
<br>

...and select _SVN Repository Exploring_ (see Fig. 4)

<p align=center>http://econference.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/svn3.JPG <br>
<p align=center>*Figure 4. Add the SVN Repository Exploring perpective to the workbench*</p>
<br>
<br>

After switching to the _SVN Repository Exploring_ perspective, add a new repository as shown below (Fig. 5).

<p align=center>http://econference.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/svn4.JPG <br>
<p align=center>*Figure 5. Add the SVN Repository Location*</p>
<br>
<br>

Now, enter {{{http://agileplanner-for-econference.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/}}} in the url field of the wizard and click the _Finish_ button. Accept the Digital Certificate when prompted.
<br>
<br>

Once Subclipse has finished fetching data from the new repository, you will see the repository name show up in the tree table viewer on the left pane. Browse _Trunk_, then select all the plugins and right-click and choose _Checkout..._ from the menu. 

A 2-steps wizard will guide you. You are going to checkout each plugin as a separate project into your workspace. It could take a while, so be patient.

== Building the workspace ==
Once either the checkout or the import is complete, you can build your workspace, but just make sure that the Java compiler compliance level is set to 1.6 (see Fig. 8)


<p align=center>http://econference.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/javasettings.JPG <br>
<p align=center>*Figure 8. Set the Java Compiler Compliance Level to 1.6*</p>
<br>
<br>
